question: You are about to make a right hand turn at this intersection. You have the green light. You hear a siren and then see that a fire truck will soon overtake you. You should:
correctAnswer: Stop and let the fire truck overtake you.
incorrectAnswers: Speed up to beat the fire truck.
Continue and make the turn because you have the right of way.

question: What does this sign mean?
correctAnswer: All right lane traffic must turn right at the next intersection.
incorrectAnswers: One way traffic ahead.
Right lane traffic may turn right or go straight ahead at the next intersection.

question: You must give way to pedestrians on a marked pedestrian crossing:
correctAnswer: If there is any danger of a collision.
incorrectAnswers: When they are crossing from your left only.
When they are crossing from your right only.

question: When the road is marked this way are you permitted to cross the lines and overtake?
correctAnswer: No.
incorrectAnswers: Yes.
Yes, only if the way ahead is clear.

question: If you are caught speeding through a road work zone you will:
correctAnswer: Be liable for a speeding fine and loss of demerit points.
incorrectAnswers: Not receive any penalty as road works speed limits are only advisory.
Receive a warning letter in the mail.

question: If turning at an intersection are you required to give way to pedestrians?
correctAnswer: Yes, a driver turning right or left must give way to pedestrians, if there is a danger of a collision
incorrectAnswers: Yes, only if turning right.
Yes, only if turning left.

question: You must use your indicator lights when:
correctAnswer: Changing lanes or turning left or right.
incorrectAnswers: Double parking.
Approaching a curve.

question: When you wish to turn left at a roundabout you indicate:
correctAnswer: Left from start to finish.
incorrectAnswers: Left only after you enter the roundabout.
Only if you think it necessary.

question: If you hear the siren of an emergency vehicle, you must:
correctAnswer: Take whatever action is necessary (with safety) to make way for the emergency vehicle.
incorrectAnswers: Flash your headlights to warn other drivers.
Increase your speed to avoid the vehicle.

question: How should you merge with traffic when entering a motorway?
correctAnswer: Watch for a gap and increase your speed to safely merge with the traffic.
incorrectAnswers: Stop, then enter the traffic quickly.
Slow down and force your way into the traffic.

question: What does this sign mean?
correctAnswer: Drive carefully, and watch out for kangaroos entering the road for the next 30 km.
incorrectAnswers: Nature reserve 30 km ahead.
Zoo 30 km ahead.

question: When going on a long trip, out of the following which is the most important to do?
correctAnswer: Get plenty of rest before starting out.
incorrectAnswers: Have a good meal before driving.
Make sure your horn is working.

question: In wet weather when it becomes hard for you to see, you should:
correctAnswer: Turn on your headlights, slow down, and double your following distance behind the vehicle in front.
incorrectAnswers: Flash your headlights to warn other drivers.
Turn your headlights on high beam.

question: You come to an intersection in Sydney with a Light Rail vehicle about to enter. What should you do?
correctAnswer: Wait until the intersection is clear.
incorrectAnswers: Change lanes before crossing the intersection.
Enter the intersection, but keep away from the Light Rail vehicle.

question: Speed limit signs (such as the one shown) tell drivers:
correctAnswer: The maximum speed they are allowed to drive.
incorrectAnswers: The recommended speed they are allowed to drive.
The minimum speed they are allowed to drive.

question: When you see children on or near the road:
correctAnswer: You should slow down and be more careful because they may move suddenly.
incorrectAnswers: You should ignore them and pay attention to the rear vision mirror.
You should reduce your speed by 5 km/h.

question: Are you permitted to park on a median strip or traffic island?
correctAnswer: No, not at any time
incorrectAnswers: Yes, but for no more than 30 minutes
Yes, in daylight hours

question: This sign means you should:
correctAnswer: Pass to the left of the sign.
incorrectAnswers: Drive carefully, roundabout ahead.
Turn left at next street.

question: What does this sign mean?
correctAnswer: You may travel only in the direction in which the arrow is pointing.
incorrectAnswers: One lane bridge ahead, slow down.
No left turn.

question: Driving faster than the maximum speed limit is:
correctAnswer: Never legally permitted.
incorrectAnswers: Only permitted when other vehicles are going faster than the speed limit.
Permitted only when passing another vehicle.

question: When you see this sign you must:
correctAnswer: Stop at the stop line and give way to all traffic.
incorrectAnswers: Stop at the stop line and give way to all traffic on your right only.
Slow down and be prepared to stop only if there is any danger of a collision with another vehicle or pedestrian.

question: Signalling is:
correctAnswer: Always required before turning or lane changing.
incorrectAnswers: Not required when turning at traffic lights with a green arrow.
Not required when turning at T-intersections.

question: When passengers get in the car and do not put their seat belts on, the safest thing to do is:
correctAnswer: Tell them the car has seat belts and they should wear them.
incorrectAnswers: Drive slower than you normally would so the passengers are safe.
Say nothing because it's the passengers' responsibility to wear their seat belts.

question: If you are affected by a legal drug, such as a medicine (e.g. cold or allergy tablets):
correctAnswer: You must not drive.
incorrectAnswers: You may drive only in daylight hours.
You must have a passenger to help you drive.

question: What does this sign mean?
correctAnswer: Vehicles carrying three or more people, and motorcycles may use this lane.
incorrectAnswers: Motor cars carrying one passenger may use this lane.
This lane is reserved for bicycle riders only.

question: Temporary traffic lights at road works:
correctAnswer: Must be obeyed.
incorrectAnswers: Are installed to warn motorists of construction works.
Apply to road works vehicles only.

question: You are in car marked A. You wish to overtake car marked B. You should:
correctAnswer: Wait behind car B until it moves into the left lane.
incorrectAnswers: Cross the line and overtake only if it is safe.
Cross the unbroken single line and overtake.

question: A friend lends you a van that has seats for ten passengers. What type of licence do you need to drive this type of vehicle?
correctAnswer: A car licence.
incorrectAnswers: A heavy rigid vehicle licence.
A small bus licence.

question: Looking at the diagrams, how far from the approach side of a bus stop or a railway crossing are you allowed to stand or park your vehicle?
correctAnswer: At least 20 metres.
incorrectAnswers: At least 5 metres.
At least 10 metres
At least 50 metres.

question: You drive towards these people on the road. What should you do?
correctAnswer: Stop and give way if there is any danger of hitting them.
incorrectAnswers: Continue at the same speed and sound the horn.
Slow down until they are half way through the crossing and drive on.

question: Which of the following statements is correct?
correctAnswer: You must give way to pedestrians if there is a danger of a collision.
incorrectAnswers: You do not have to give way to adults crossing at children's crossings.
Pedestrians must cross the road only at marked crossings and intersections.

question: What does this sign mean?
correctAnswer: Railway level crossing ahead, slow down and look out for trains, be prepared to stop.
incorrectAnswers: Give way sign ahead, slow down and be prepared to stop.
Cattle or sheep crossing the road ahead, drive slowly.

question: To turn back into the same road from which you joined this roundabout you must:
correctAnswer: Stay in the right lane all the way round.
incorrectAnswers: Use the left lane all the way round.
Move into the left lane to leave the roundabout.

question: Before changing lanes you should:
correctAnswer: Signal in plenty of time, check your mirrors and look over your shoulder for other vehicles.
incorrectAnswers: Speed up so you are going faster than the traffic in the other lane.
Signal for at least two seconds and quickly change lanes.

question: If a STOP or GIVE WAY sign has been knocked down, for example, as the result of an accident, does the line marked across the road have any meaning?
correctAnswer: Yes, it has the same meaning as the sign itself.
incorrectAnswers: No, you only need to give way to the vehicle on your right.
No, but you must give way if turning.

question: Before getting out of your vehicle you must:
correctAnswer: Check your mirrors and blind spots for pedestrians, bicycles or other vehicles.
incorrectAnswers: Check your headlights are turned off.
Check your seatbelt is back in place.

question: This bridge has only just enough room for two vehicles. As you come close to it you should:
correctAnswer: Slow down and pay extra attention.
incorrectAnswers: Maintain your speed, keeping to the limit.
Sound your horn to warn the other driver.

question: You are in car A and want to turn right at this intersection. Car B facing you is also indicating to turn right. What path should you take?
correctAnswer: Both pass in front of each other.
incorrectAnswers: Choose either depending on the traffic.
Pass behind each other.

question: When you see this sign you should:
correctAnswer: Come to a complete stop, look both ways for trains and proceed with caution if no trains are approaching.
incorrectAnswers: Stop, only if a train is at the crossing.
Slow down, then drive slowly over the crossing looking both ways for trains.

question: You are going to turn right from a one-way street. Where should you be when you start your turn?
correctAnswer: Position R. As close as possible to the right side of the road.
incorrectAnswers: Position M. From the middle of the road.
Any position if it is safe to do so.

question: The faster the vehicle in front of you is travelling, the:
correctAnswer: More distance and time you need to overtake.
incorrectAnswers: Less time you need to overtake.
Closer you must get before starting to overtake.
